verses.verse: For the Chief Musician. A Psalm of David; when Nathan the prophet came unto him, after he had gone in to Bath-sheba. Have mercy <S%H2603><s%> upon me <S%H430><s%>, O God, according to thy lovingkindness <S%H2617><s%>: According to the multitude <S%H7230><s%> of thy tender mercies <S%H7356><s%> blot <S%H4229><s%> out my transgressions <S%H6588><s%>.
Wash <S%H3526><s%> me thoroughly <S%H7235><s%> from mine iniquity <S%H5771><s%>, And cleanse <S%H2891><s%> me from my sin <S%H2403><s%>.
For I know <S%H3045><s%> my transgressions <S%H6588><s%>; And my sin <S%H2403><s%> is ever before me <S%H8548><s%>.

Against thee <S%H2398><s%>, thee only, have I sinned, And done <S%H6213><s%> that which is evil <S%H7451><s%> in thy sight <S%H5869><s%>; That thou mayest be justified <S%H6663><s%> when thou speakest <S%H1696><s%>, And be clear <S%H2135><s%> when thou judgest <S%H8199><s%>.
Behold <S%H2342><s%>, I was brought forth in iniquity <S%H5771><s%>; And in sin <S%H2399><s%> did my mother <S%H517><s%> conceive me <S%H3179><s%>.
Behold <S%H2654><s%>, thou desirest truth <S%H571><s%> in the inward parts <S%H2910><s%>; And in the hidden <S%H5640><s%> part thou wilt make me to know <S%H3045><s%> wisdom <S%H2451><s%>.
Purify <S%H2398><s%> me with hyssop <S%H231><s%>, and I shall be clean <S%H2891><s%>: Wash <S%H3526><s%> me <S%H3835><s%>, and I shall be whiter than snow <S%H7950><s%>.
Make me to hear <S%H8085><s%> joy <S%H8342><s%> and gladness <S%H8057><s%>, That the bones <S%H6106><s%> which thou hast broken <S%H1794><s%> may rejoice <S%H1523><s%>.
Hide <S%H5641><s%> thy face <S%H6440><s%> from my sins <S%H2399><s%>, And blot out <S%H4229><s%> all mine iniquities <S%H5771><s%>.
Create <S%H1254><s%> in me a clean <S%H2889><s%> heart <S%H3820><s%>, O God <S%H430><s%>; And renew <S%H2318><s%> a right <S%H3559><s%> spirit <S%H7307><s%> within me <S%H7130><s%>.
Cast me not away <S%H7993><s%> from thy presence <S%H6440><s%>; And take <S%H3947><s%> not thy holy <S%H6944><s%> Spirit from me <S%H7307><s%>.
Restore <S%H7725><s%> unto me the joy <S%H8342><s%> of thy salvation <S%H3468><s%>; And uphold <S%H5564><s%> me with a willing <S%H5081><s%> spirit <S%H7307><s%>.
Then will I teach <S%H3925><s%> transgressors <S%H6586><s%> thy ways <S%H1870><s%>; And sinners <S%H2400><s%> shall be converted unto thee <S%H7725><s%>.

Deliver <S%H5337><s%> me from bloodguiltiness <S%H1818><s%>, O God <S%H430><s%>, thou God <S%H430><s%> of my salvation <S%H8668><s%>; And my tongue <S%H3956><s%> shall sing aloud <S%H7442><s%> of thy righteousness <S%H6666><s%>.
O Lord <S%H136><s%>, open <S%H6605><s%> thou my lips <S%H8193><s%>; And my mouth <S%H6310><s%> shall show forth <S%H5046><s%> thy praise <S%H8416><s%>.
For thou delightest <S%H2654><s%> not in sacrifice <S%H2077><s%>; else would I give <S%H5414><s%> it <S%H7521><s%>: Thou hast no pleasure in burnt-offering <S%H5930><s%>.

The sacrifices <S%H2077><s%> of God <S%H430><s%> are a broken <S%H7665><s%> spirit <S%H7307><s%>: A broken <S%H7665><s%> and contrite <S%H1794><s%> heart <S%H3820><s%>, O God <S%H430><s%>, thou wilt not despise <S%H959><s%>.
Do good <S%H3190><s%> in thy good pleasure <S%H7522><s%> unto Zion <S%H6726><s%>: Build <S%H1129><s%> thou the walls <S%H2346><s%> of Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%>.

Then will thou delight <S%H2654><s%> in the sacrifices <S%H2077><s%> of righteousness <S%H6664><s%>, In burnt-offering <S%H5930><s%> and in whole <S%H3632><s%> burnt-offering <S%H5930><s%>: Then will they offer <S%H5927><s%> bullocks <S%H6499><s%> upon thine altar <S%H4196><s%>.
